title: Address "non-finishing" batched processes properly

labels.name: severity-important
labels.description: major effect on the usability of a package, without rendering it completely unusable to everyone

body:
"Introduced" within https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/4829/files#diff-9f14d6f5afddd497b06677e855a05d9eR1333

- our "waiting time" might be insufficient in legit cases, so we should not just abandon git-annex processes and proceed (e.g. with a commit) since it could lead to inconsistent commits (yet to be seen, but I saw batched processes exiting peacefully after 1 or 2 loops)
- reported to @joeyh : https://git-annex.branchable.com/bugs/some_annex_addurl_--fast_--with-files_--json_--json-error-messages_--batch__do_not_quit/ . More investigation is needed, may be bisection of git-annex (yet to double check that older versions aren't the subject to this) and more careful analysis of changes in #4829 on what has introduced that effect
- the way I  reproduce it mimics original stall on CI
```shell
(dev3) test@smaug:~/proj/datalad/datalad$ git diff
diff --git a/datalad/cmd.py b/datalad/cmd.py
index d4d54eb46..c8a666e24 100644
--- a/datalad/cmd.py
+++ b/datalad/cmd.py
@@ -1353,6 +1353,7 @@ class BatchedCommand(SafeDelCloseMixin):
                     timeout=3.0,
                 )
             except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
+                import pdb; pdb.set_trace()
                 lgr.warning(
                     "Batched process %s did not finish, abandoning it without killing it",
                     process)
...
(dev3) test@smaug:~/proj/datalad/datalad-crawler/__testhome__$ PATH=~/git-annex/20201005-snapshot/ DATALAD_LOG_LEVEL=WARNING DATALAD_TESTS_TEMP_KEEP=1 python -m nose -s -v --with-cov --cover-package datalad ../datalad_crawler/dbs/tests/test_files.py ../datalad_crawler/nodes/tests/test_annex.py
```
and end up in pdb upon timeout
